DataElement.preferredName: Specimen Collection To Sequencing Library Preparation Day Count
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The number of days from the date a specimen was collected to the date of the sequencing library preparation.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Biospecimen Biospecimen Collection To Sequencing Library Preparation
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Any material sample taken from a biological entity for testing, diagnostic, propagation, treatment or research purposes, including a sample obtained from a living organism or taken from the biological object after halting of all its life functions. Biospecimen can contain one or more components including but not limited to cellular molecules, cells, tissues, organs, body fluids, embryos, and body excretory products.:The act or process of gathering biospecimens for testing, diagnostic, propagation, treatment or research purposes._Used as a function word to indicate direction, purpose, or movement._A collection of double stranded DNA fragments flanked by oligonucleotide sequence adapters to enable their analysis by high-throughput sequencing._The act or process of making something ready.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Any material sample taken from a biological entity for testing, diagnostic, propagation, treatment or research purposes, including a sample obtained from a living organism or taken from the biological object after halting of all its life functions. Biospecimen can contain one or more components including but not limited to cellular molecules, cells, tissues, organs, body fluids, embryos, and body excretory products.

Concepts.definition: Any material sample taken from a biological entity for testing, diagnostic, propagation, treatment or research purposes, including a sample obtained from a living organism or taken from the biological object after halting of all its life functions. Biospecimen can contain one or more components including but not limited to cellular molecules, cells, tissues, organs, body fluids, embryos, and body excretory products.

Property.preferredName: Biospecimen Collection To Sequencing Library Preparation
Property.preferredDefinition: The act or process of gathering biospecimens for testing, diagnostic, propagation, treatment or research purposes._Used as a function word to indicate direction, purpose, or movement._A collection of double stranded DNA fragments flanked by oligonucleotide sequence adapters to enable their analysis by high-throughput sequencing._The act or process of making something ready.

Concepts.definition: The act or process of gathering biospecimens for testing, diagnostic, propagation, treatment or research purposes.
Used as a function word to indicate direction, purpose, or movement.
A collection of double stranded DNA fragments flanked by oligonucleotide sequence adapters to enable their analysis by high-throughput sequencing.
The act or process of making something ready.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Any specific activity undertaken during the course of a clinical study or research protocol.

DataElementConcept.administrativeNotes: 11/20/23 Created per CCDI submission template. mr

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The time for Earth to make a complete rotation on its axis; ordinarily divided into twenty-four hours, equal to 86 400 seconds. This also refers to a specific day._To determine the number or amount of something; the result of this activity.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: The time for Earth to make a complete rotation on its axis; ordinarily divided into twenty-four hours.:To determine the number or amount of something; the result of this activity.

Concepts.definition: The time for Earth to make a complete rotation on its axis; ordinarily divided into twenty-four hours, equal to 86 400 seconds. This also refers to a specific day.
Determining the number or amount of something.
